unnormalised: Breaking News: Forget your anniversary, remember THIS!
normalised: Breaking News: Forget your anniversary, remember THIS!

unnormalised: In a bizarre turn of events, the Ministry of Education has announced that remembering your enrollment number (EDU2023-6789-MH) is now more vital than remembering your spouse's birthday. Failure to recall your student ID could lead to temporary amnesia about why you're eating Maggi at 3 AM.
normalised: In a bizarre turn of events, the Ministry of Education has announced that remembering your enrollment number (E-D-U two thousand twenty three dash six thousand seven hundred eighty nine dash M-H) is now more vital than remembering your spouse's birthday. Failure to recall your student I-D could lead to temporary amnesia about why you're eating Maggi at three A-M.

unnormalised: And it doesn't stop there. HR departments across India are scrambling to implement new policies where employees must recite their employee ID (XYZ-12345-DL) backward during appraisal meetings. Sources say this is to "test commitment." One employee, ID number PQR-56789-KA, was seen practicing his ID backward while stuck in Bangalore traffic. "Better this than another pep talk about 'synergy'," he muttered.
normalised: And it doesn't stop there. H-R departments across India are scrambling to implement new policies where employees must recite their employee I-D (X-Y-Z dash one two three four five dash D-L) backward during appraisal meetings. Sources say this is to "test commitment." One employee, I-D number P-Q-R dash five six seven eight nine dash K-A, was seen practicing his I-D backward while stuck in Bangalore traffic. "Better this than another pep talk about 'synergy'," he muttered.

unnormalised: Meanwhile, cyber cafes are reporting a surge in "Urgent Help!" requests. "My grandma forgot her pension ID! Is there a 'Forgot Password' option for life?" cried one distraught grandson, holding a tattered document with the number PENS-2010-ABCD. We suggest writing it in permanent marker on her forehead. (Disclaimer: We do NOT endorse writing on foreheads.)
normalised: Meanwhile, cyber cafes are reporting a surge in "Urgent Help!" requests. "My grandma forgot her pension I-D! Is there a 'Forgot Password' option for life?" cried one distraught grandson, holding a tattered document with the number P-E-N-S dash two thousand ten dash A-B-C-D. We suggest writing it in permanent marker on her forehead. (Disclaimer: We do N-O-T endorse writing on foreheads.)
